abstract.text: Learn about new features and updates in the App Store Server API.

legalNotices.copyright: Copyright © 2025 Apple Inc. All rights reserved.

inlineContent.text: Use this changelog to learn about feature updates, deprecations, and removals for the App Store Server API.
Added support for Advanced Commerce API.
Added the win-back offer type in
, which provides transaction history for all In-App Purchases, including consumable In-App Purchases in a finished state.
endpoint is deprecated. Use the new
added  support for receiving information for auto-renewable subscriptions.
The system no longer sends the
endpoint adds support for the new notification type for unreported external purchase tokens.
Added the following new properties in the decoded transaction payload
Updated the error format of the
endpoint to match that of other endpoints. The endpoint now returns a JSON body that can contain an error code.
, which provides information about a single transaction.
endpoint adds a new filter parameter,
, the endpoint returns only the notifications that failed to reach the developer’s server.
The following endpoints changed their path parameters from
. These endpoints now accept any transaction identifier, including original transaction identifiers.
instead of requiring an original transaction identifier (
endpoint adds a new filter parameter,
, that filters the response to return only revoked transactions or only nonrevoked transactions.
endpoint adds a new filter parameter,
, that enables you to request subscriptions with the status values you specify.
to provide information about all the send attempts for App Store Server Notifications.
All endpoints are subject to a rate limit and can return a
with an HTTP 429 error code. For more information, see
takes a subscription product identifier and extends the renewal date for all eligible subscribers. It responds with
. For information about new App Store server notifications related to this endpoint, see the
checks the status of a subscription-renewal-date extension, and responds with the
returns a paginated list of refunded transactions in the
value is deprecated and replaced with
The API has two new endpoints to support testing how your server receives App Store Server Notifications. The endpoints are:
endpoint is enhanced with new parameters to support filtering and sorting functionality.
This version doesn’t contain any public changes.
This version doesn’t contain any public changes.
endpoint now returns a maximum of 50 refunded transactions.
The API is now available in the production environment, using the following base URL:
Initial version of the App Store Server API.
This API has three endpoints, available in the sandbox environment:

abstract.text: Manage your customers’ App Store transactions from your server.
An error that indicates the endpoint doesn’t support an app transaction ID.
A response that contains the contents of the App Store server’s test notification and the result from your server.
The request body containing consumption information.
An error that indicates a subscription isn’t directly eligible for a renewal date extension because the customer obtained it through Family Sharing.
Get a customer’s in-app purchase transaction history for your app, except finished consumable in-app purchases.
Get a customer’s in-app purchases from a receipt using the order ID.
Check the status of the test App Store server notification sent to your server.
Get a list of up to 50 of a customer’s refunded in-app purchases for your app.
Get the statuses for all of a customer’s auto-renewable subscriptions in your app.
Checks whether a renewal date extension request completed, and provides the final count of successful or failed extensions.

doc://com.apple.appstoreserverapi/docume.title: Get Status of Subscription Renewal Date Extensions

abstract.text: Get information about a single transaction for your app.
Get a customer’s in-app purchase transaction history for your app.
Get a paginated list of all of a customer’s refunded in-app purchases for your app.
An error that indicates the value of the account tenure field is invalid.
An error that indicates the value of the app account token field is invalid.
An error that indicates the value of the consumption status field is invalid.
An error that indicates the customer consented field is invalid or doesn’t indicate that the customer consented.
An error that indicates the value in the delivery status field is invalid.
An error that indicates the value in the lifetime dollars purchased field is invalid.
An error that indicates the value in the lifetime dollars refunded field is invalid.
An error that indicates the value in the platform field is invalid.
An error that indicates the value in the playtime field is invalid.
An error that indicates the revoked parameter contains an invalid value.
An error that indicates the value in the sample content provided field is invalid.
An error that indicates the status parameter is invalid.
An error that indicates an invalid transaction identifier.
An error that indicates the transaction identifier doesn’t represent a consumable In-App Purchase.
An error that indicates the transaction identifier represents an unsupported In-App Purchase type.
An error that indicates the value in the user status field is invalid.
A decoded JSON Web Signature (JWS) header containing transaction or renewal information.
A decoded payload containing subscription renewal information for an auto-renewable subscription.
A decoded payload that contains transaction information.
A response that indicates the server successfully received the subscription-renewal-date extension request.
A response that indicates the current status of a request to extend the subscription renewal date to all eligible subscribers.
The request body for notification history.
A response that contains the App Store Server Notifications history for your app.
Get a list of notifications that the App Store server attempted to send to your server.
Ask App Store Server Notifications to send a test notification to your server.
Uses a subscription’s product identifier to extend the renewal date for all of its eligible active subscribers.

doc://com.apple.appstoreserverapi/docume.title: Extend Subscription Renewal Dates for All Active Subscribers

abstract.text: Extends the renewal date of a customer’s active subscription using the original transaction identifier.
Send consumption information about a consumable in-app purchase or auto-renewable subscription to the App Store after your server receives a consumption request notification.
An error that indicates the request exceeded the rate limit.
A response that contains an array of signed JSON Web Signature (JWS) refunded transactions, and paging information.
A response that contains an array of signed JSON Web Signature (JWS) transactions.
An error that indicates the server didn’t find a subscription-renewal-date extension request for the request identifier and product identifier you provided.
An error that indicates a transaction identifier wasn’t found.
A response that contains signed transaction information for a single transaction.
The UUID that an app optionally generates to map a customer’s In-App Purchase with its resulting App Store transaction.
The unique identifier of the app download transaction.
Create API keys you use to sign JSON Web Tokens and authorize API requests.

doc://com.apple.appstoreserverapi/docume.title: Creating API keys to authorize API requests

abstract.text: The three-letter ISO 4217 currency code for the price of the product.
An array of win-back offer identifiers that a customer is eligible to redeem, which sorts the identifiers with the best offers first.
The server environment, either sandbox or production.
Compensate eligible active subscribers for service interruptions by extending a subscription’s renewal date.

doc://com.apple.appstoreserverapi/docume.title: Extending the renewal date for auto-renewable subscriptions

abstract.text: Create JSON Web Tokens signed with your private key to authorize requests for App Store Server API and External Purchase Server API.

doc://com.apple.appstoreserverapi/docume.title: Generating JSON Web Tokens for API requests

abstract.text: Recognize the rate limits that apply to App Store Server API endpoints and handle them in your code.
The App Store server notification history record, including the signed notification payload and the result of the server’s first send attempt.
The payment mode for subscription offers on an auto-renewable subscription.
The duration of the offer.
The type of subscription offer.
A Boolean value that indicates whether the response includes only notifications that failed to reach your server.
The original transaction identifier of a purchase.
The price, in milliunits, of the In-App Purchase that the system records in the transaction.
The earliest start date of a subscription in a series of auto-renewable subscription purchases that ignores all lapses of paid service shorter than 60 days.
A value that indicates your preferred outcome for the refund request.
The UNIX time, in milliseconds, when the most recent auto-renewable subscription purchase expires.
The renewal price, in milliunits, of the auto-renewable subscription that renews at the next billing period.
The success or error information and the date the App Store server records when it attempts to send a server notification to your server.
Use Apple’s open source library to create JSON Web Tokens (JWT) to authorize your calls, verify transactions, extract transaction identifiers from receipts, and more.

doc://com.apple.appstoreserverapi/docume.title: Simplifying your implementation by using the App Store Server Library

abstract.text: The three-letter code that represents the country or region associated with the App Store storefront of the purchase.
An Apple-defined value that uniquely identifies an App Store storefront.
The unique identifier for a transaction, such as an In-App Purchase, restored In-App Purchase, or subscription renewal.
The cause of a purchase transaction, which indicates whether it’s a customer’s purchase or a renewal for an auto-renewable subscription that the system initiates.
Learn about changes to the App Store Server Notifications service.
The price, in milliunits, of the In-App Purchase that the system records in the transaction.
